title: Stephanie Davis is proud as punch of little Caben amid Jeremy McConnell drama
text:

Hollyoaks' Stephanie Davis is chuffed to bits with her little man.

Sharing a snap with her Twitter followers of two year-old Caben looking incredibly dapper in his school uniform, the actress wrote: "Proud mum post.

"Caben is really advanced for his age and absolutely thriving at the moment, he's been visiting pre-school for a while now, he loves it and doesn't like going back to the nursery class, it would be unfair to keep him there when he gets frustrated because he wants to be doing and learning more.

"His speech, potty training (he now goes stood up like a big boy) his numbers etc. So they have decided to move him up early!

"He went in so happy today and feel so proud that he's doing so well. How grown up in his school uniform."

Dad Jeremy, meanwhile, has struck out at accusations that he hadn't been on dad duty and was "neglecting" his son.

The former Mr Ireland doesn't see Caben anymore after he was found guilty of assaulting Stephanie in a cocaine-fulled rage when they were together.

He told the Mail Online that he's had a proper crack at turning his life around, but despite his best efforts the rift with Stephanie cant be healed.

(Image: Instagram)

He said: "Anyone that had half a brain cell needs to understand the reason I am not part of Caben's life is because not every situation can be fixed."

Jeremy continued: "I protect my son as much as I can. It's not neglecting, it's protecting. I'm a very loving father. This is better for Caben."

He's now expecting a baby girl with girlfriend Katie McCreath, due in a few months time.

He added: "My priority is my baby girl because it's in my control - I have rights over that. My main focus is my girl.

"I can't speak about it much for legal reasons, but Steph is doing a great job. She's doing really well and I know she's a good mum."
description: Stephanie shared a heartwearming post about Caben moving up to pre-school after dad Jeremy denied 'neglecting' his boy
